Title: Fragile structures, egos derail opposition as PDP fumes, SDP splinters
Summary: Nigeria’s opposition parties are again mired in self-inflicted turmoil, with the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) fuming over zoning .

Summary: Pipeline Infrastructure Nigeria Limited said it had expanded its operations ‘pro bono’ to include all oil and gas surveillance . Summary: INEC observes as Plateau PDP gets new executives . Raymond Dabo was elected as its new State Chairman, alongside  Raymond Dabo . The Plateau chapter of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) at the weekend .

Title: Southeast business community converge on Enugu for ECOWAS ETLS
Summary: Southeast business community converge on Enugu for ECOWAS ETLS . Business community in the South-East geopolitical zone will tomorrow converge for the Economic Community of West African States .

Title: Educational fair inspires next generation of Nigerian students
Summary: On October 18, 2025, the Lycée Français Louis Pasteur in Lagos opened its doors to hundreds of enthusiastic students for the Choose France fair .

Title: Police dismiss fear of unrest, assure safety on Third Mainland Bridge
Summary: Police said officers have been fully deployed to ensure the safety of all road users . Officers have been deployed to prevent any form of obstruction or breach of the peace .

Title: Anambra election to be conducted in 5,718 polling units
Summary: INEC has announced that it will conduct the forthcoming Anambra governorship election in 5,718 of the 5,720 polling units across the state .

Title: Soludo’s campaign moves to Orumba
Summary: Governor Chukwuma Soludo took his campaign to Ajalli as part of his electoral campaign for the November, 8 gubernatorial election .

Title: Nnamdi Kanu held unjustly, his release will bring peace to South-East  —  Nwoko
Summary: Nwoko says Kanu’s prolonged detention has further deepened grievances and unrest in the South-Est region . He says his release will bring peace to South-East  —  Nwoko .

Title: CBN pumps $1.25bn into fuel import, others
Summary: The Central Bank of Nigeria has released a total sum of $1.259bn to oil sector players for the importation of petroleum products and other related items . The amount released between the first three months of 2025 is against the backdrop of the insistence of marketers to continue fuel import despite the availability of petrol from Dangote refinery .

Title: Speeding driver dies in Lagos road crash
Summary: A yet-to-be-identified driver who was said to be under the influence of alcohol has lost his life after his vehicle somersaulted due to excessive speeding along the Iponri Bridge in the Lagos Island area of the state . Title: FIRS grows tax collection to N47.39tn
Summary: The Federal Inland Revenue Service has achieved a record-breaking tax collection of N47.39tn between October 2023 and September 2025, The PUNCH reports . The tax agency exceeded its revenue target by 15 per cent .

Title: A’Ibom NMA raises N11m for five ailing members
Summary: The Nigerian Medical Association, Akwa Ibom State chapter, released over N11m endowment fund for the treatment of five sick members in one year .
